class nourisher.manager.MultiScrapper[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

This is for collecting data for multiple source URLs

Attributes

sourceURLs (list of strings) list of URLs which we want to scrap
goodOnes (list of strings) urls which were processed correctly
badOnes (list of strings) urls which were processed correctly
counter (int) number of processed URLs so far

Methods

fetch_urls(filePath) Get urls from file and appends them to sourceURLs.
scrap_data([startingPoint, sleepInt, logFile]) Scrap all URLs from sourceURLs
badOnes = []¶
counter = 0¶
fetch_urls(filePath)[source]¶

Get urls from file and appends them to sourceURLs.

This file must have one url address on every line, encoding utf-8.

goodOnes = []¶
scrap_data(startingPoint=0, sleepInt=300, logFile='scrap.log')[source]¶

Scrap all URLs from sourceURLs

Parameters:

startingPoint : int

from which url in sourceURLs should be started

sleepInt : int

number of seconds to wait between every loop (because of bans on some servers)

logFile : strings

path to file where you want to save log
sourceURLs = []¶

get_objectid()[source]¶

Try to find out by origFeedUrl if it is already in database and if it is, it is returned

When more than one are found, last one is returned

Returns:

ObjectID

ObjectID of existing item in database which has been inserted as a lastone
origFeedUrl = None¶

nourisher.utiliser module¶

Created on Dec 20, 2014

@author: dan

Here are some utilities that might be useful

nourisher.utiliser.find_objects_by_origurl(origUrl, dbName='testdb', collection='feeds', ip='localhost', port=5432)[source]¶

Try to find object by original URL of feed and returns the LAST one inserted

Parameters:

origUrl : string of URL

URL by which we should find in database

dbName: string, optional

default in settings, name of database to write into

collection: string, optional

default in settings, Name of collection to write into

ip: string, optional

default in settings, IP where is MongoDB running

port: interger, optional

default in settings, port where is MongoDB running
Returns:

ObjectID

of last inserted matching document
Raises:

IndexError

When no document is found

nourisher.utiliser.get_id_of_last_inserted(dbName='testdb', collection='feeds', ip='localhost', port=5432)[source]¶

Get ObjectID of last inserted document from pymongo import MongoClient

default in settings, name of database to write into

collection: string, optional

default in settings, Name of collection to write into

ip: string, optional

default in settings, IP where is MongoDB running

port: interger, optional

default in settings, port where is MongoDB running
Returns:

ObjectID : ObjectID

last inserted document to collection
nourisher.utiliser.informer(msg, *args, level=1, rewrite=False)[source]¶

Used for getting output from program

Parameters:

msg : everything what is possible to print

whatever you want to see as an output

Warning Don’t mix str + int etc. which are not easily printed together. They can be added as *args.

*args

Everything passed as an argument is going to be printed

level : positive integer, currently implemented [0,1,2], optional

default 1, level of verbosity for which at least should be this message printed

rewrite : True or False, optional, default False

if True, then the output is going to be rewritten on the same line as the previous. If False, then the outpus is going to be printed on next line
nourisher.utiliser.maternal_url_extractor(finalLinks)[source]¶

Try to find out most probable maternal URL based on entries

Parameters:

finalLinks : list

true finalUrls of entries
Returns:

string

maternal URL (in www.maternalurl.*)
